review: I'm a big fan of Prime and Amazon. But, after a week, the fire stick has proved pretty useless. It doesn't connect to a verified network - constantly failing and asking for the password. It also freezes constantly. I was really excited about streaming new content but I'd rather go back to my TV's apps than hurdle this thing. It also requires a a power source plugged into it which, is just kinda lame.

review: I really like the ease of setting up the stick on my spare TV. I also really like the fact that EVERYTHING came with the purchase (i.e., the stick, an HDMI cord, an HDMI/stick extension, power cable, batteries and remote). Here's what I was not happy with: 1) Trying to open the remote back to install the batteries took nearly 45 minutes! I had to use a paring knife to separate the edge in order to push down and then pull the back out. You might want to have users of different age groups with dis/abilities test the ease of handling; and 2) send better instructions for use of the device. It is silly to purchase this, then be expected to buy a Fire Stick/TV manual for $8.99.
